text: Aaron Harold Schroeder (September 7, 1926 – December 2, 2009) was an American songwriter and music publisher. He was born in Brooklyn, New York. He wrote seventeen songs for Elvis Presley including five that reached number one: "A Big Hunk o' Love", "Good Luck Charm", "I Got Stung", "Stuck on You" and "It's Now or Never". Schroeder was founder and president of Musicor Records (1960–1965). He also helped Gene Pitney become famous.Pitney, Gene, Gene Pitney:25 All-Time Greatest Hits, Varese Sarabande, 1999, liner notes Schroeder died on December 2, 2009, in Englewood, New Jersey from primary progressive aphasia, a rare form of dementia, aged 83.Songwriter Aaron Schroeder dead at 83, upi.com, December 6, 2009. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Deaths from primary progressive aphasia Category:American record producers Category:American songwriters Category:Writers from New York City Category:Businesspeople from New York City
title: Aaron Schroeder
